Dongjie Chen

About Me

I’m a Surgery Ph.D. candidate at Shanghai Jiao Tong University’s Ruijin Hospital, working under the mentorship of Prof. Baiyong SHEN. My research involves exploring the mechanism of the development of pancreatic cancer based on multi-omics.

Prior to joining the Ph.D. program, I completed my master’s degree in Surgery from Third Xiangya Hospital，Central South University advised by Prof. Xiao Yu, and my bachelor’s degree in Clinical Medicine from Hunan University of Chinese Medicine.

Outside of academia, I’m also passionate about singing and took part in the Top Ten Singers competition in our school. In addition, I am also interested in oil painting, and aeromodelling.

Research Interests

  • Multi-omics: transcriptomics, proteomics and metabonomics
  • Single-cell & Spatial transcriptome: cell-cell communication, and deconvnetion analysis
  • Tumor microenvironment: immune scape, and immunotherapy
  • Machine Learning: AI, penalization and augmentation methods

Awards

  • [2019] National Scholarship, Central South University;
  • [2019,2021,2023] First Prize Academic Scholarship, Central South University & Shanghai Jiao Tong University;
  • [2022] Outstanding Graduate, Central South University;
  • [2019] Outstanding Student, Central South University;
